author: Justin Lahart
title: The Marketâ€™s New Boss
text:
The shift has been going on for some time but it became very clear this week: Interest rates are now more important than profits for stock performance.
The first quarter was very good for U.S. companies, as a brew of corporate tax cuts, solid global economic growth and a weaker dollar pushed profits higher. Earnings at companies in the S&P 500 were an estimated 26.1% higher than a year earlier, according Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S, marking the strongest gain since 2010.
...
